title: Source: Scherzer returning to Jays for 19th season
content: Three-time Cy Young Award winner Max Scherzer has agreed to return to the Blue Jays for his 19th season, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Cincy sues transfer QB Sorsby over $1M exit fee
content: Cincinnati is suing former quarterback Brendan Sorsby, alleging he breached his NIL contract with the Bearcats by refusing to pay a $1 million exit fee following his transfer to Texas Tech.

title: UConn by 32 in Pitino's biggest loss at St. John's
content: UConn avenged a Feb. 6 loss by handing St. John's its largest defeat under Rick Pitino, a 72-40 blowout Wednesday night in which the Red Storm missed their final 24 field goal attempts.

title: Hilary Knight: Women's team joke 'distasteful'
content: American gold medalist Hilary Knight called President Trump's comment about the women's team "distasteful" but said she chooses to celebrate the women's accomplishments.

title: Third victim dies week after shooting at R.I. rink
content: A deadly shooting during a youth hockey game in Rhode Island last week claimed a third victim, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Quenneville second NHL coach to reach 1K wins
content: Joel Quenneville joined Scotty Bowman in the exclusive club when his Ducks rallied to beat the Oilers on Wednesday night.

title: Banned by NBA, Porter joins USBL's SuperHawks
content: Jontay Porter, banned for life by the NBA for gambling in 2024 and currently awaiting sentencing after pleading guilty to a related federal charge, is planning to play for an upstart pro basketball league.

title: Suns' Ishbia offers $1M to All-Star contest winners
content: Suns owner Mat Ishbia wants more star players participating in All-Star Weekend events when Phoenix hosts next year -- and is hoping to entice them by offering a $1 million prize to the winners of the slam dunk and 3-point contests.

title: üèà Kiper's NFL mock draft: Projecting Round 1
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class will get picked in April.

content: How do Brian Thomas Jr. and Maxx Crosby stack up on the trade market? We break down the latest intel.

content: The Tigers have a much easier case for one of the SEC's 10 or 11 bids after defeating Tennessee on Tuesday.

content: The schools (Oklahoma? Syracuse?), names (Will Wade? Porter Moser? Josh Schertz?) and buzz we're tracking.

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: Latest Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

content: Do any fast-rising young outfielders beat out these two New York sluggers on our top 10? Let's find out.

content: As draft prospects begin their combine experience, NFL rookies provide advice based on their personal journeys.

content: And then there were 16. Two Italian giants are out, and Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain only eked through their playoffs. So who has what it takes to win the Champions League?

title: Paris Saint-Germain's Champions League title defense on shaky ground
content: Luis Enrique's defending champs looked a shadow of their former selves, only just edging past Monaco.

content: If history predicts the future, here is what you should know about all of this year's Elimination Chamber participants.

title: Freshmen facing pressure in 2026
content: With big money and big expectations, first-year players such as five-stars Jared Curtis and Jackson Cantwell have work ahead.

title: They're back! Key returning players for every top 25 team
content: With all the focus on the portal, we look at the most important players retained across college football.

content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

content: The next stop on the PGA Tour season brings us to West Palm Beach, Florida, in a tournament that rewards those who can avoid the big numbers.

title: Premier League overreactions: Spurs to get relegated? Chelsea to set poor discipline record?
content: Let's overreact to the latest fixtures of a potentially epic Premier League season, from Spurs' dire straits to Chelsea's shot at unwanted history.

title: How do Shakhtar keep signing so many Brazilians amid Russia-Ukraine war?
content: The flow of Brazilian players to Shakhtar Donetsk hasn't stopped since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began.

title: We predicted the 12-man USA basketball roster in the 2028 Olympics
content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

title: Boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Bivol, Beterbiev out; who replaces them?
content: Dmitry Bivol and Artur Beterbiev are out of the top 10 for inactivity. Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Divisional rankings: Ryan Garcia enters welterweight top five
content: A masterful title fight performance from Garcia earns him a WBC belt and a spot among the welterweight elite.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona want Man City's Omar Marmoush
content: Barcelona are interested in Omar Marmoush as a potential alternative to Juli√°n √Ålvarez. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Fantasy fast break: Has Zion put durability questions behind him?
content: A look around the league reveals Zion Williamson finding the ability to stay on the court, plus emerging options on the Clippers, Kings and Jazz.

title: 'They fired gun & judiciary is bleeding': SC rebukes NCERT over graft chapter ‚Äî top 10 quotes
content: The Supreme Court has issued a show-cause notice to the NCERT director, calling the inclusion of a chapter on judicial corruption in a Class 8 textbook a "deep-rooted conspiracy." The court ordered the seizure of all copies of the textbook in circulation, emphasizing the need for a deeper probe to prevent erosion of public faith in the judiciary.

title: Speeding Thar in Chandigarh: Head constable‚Äôs son mows down 2 madrassa teachers
content: Two brothers from Saharanpur were killed in Chandigarh when a speeding Mahindra Thar, driven by an 18-year-old, rammed their motorcycle. The victims were en route to meet a relative when the accident occurred near Kalagram. The SUV driver was apprehended shortly after the incident.

title: Why Canada PM Carney‚Äôs India visit could mark a turning point in ties - explained
content: Carney‚Äôs visit is expected to have two major outcomes: the most significant of which could be the formal revival of negotiations for an India‚ÄìCanada Free Trade Agreement.

title: New rail tech portal & more: New Indian Railways reforms unveiled by Vaishnaw; check details
content: The two reforms unveiled today focus on a new rail tech policy, and reforms in disposal of railway claims tribunal cases. Indian Railways aims to engage innovators, startups, industry, and institutions to promote innovation.

title: Chinese govt may have sent a 'retaliatory message' to US on trade relations via Deepseek
content: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek is withholding early access to its new model from US chipmakers like Nvidia and AMD, instead sharing it with domestic partners. This move signals Beijing's tougher stance on technology and trade amid ongoing US export controls on advanced semiconductors.

title: ‚ÄòVery hard for us': Why Sri Lanka captain wants govt intervention after WC disaster
content: Sri Lankan captain Dasun Shanaka has appealed to the government to shield players from excessive criticism, citing its detrimental impact on their mental health following the team's T20 World Cup exit. Shanaka expressed frustration over the negative environment, attributing the team's performance to factors like pitch conditions and fitness issues, while apologising to fans for the disappointing results.

title: Carney, PM Modi to meet in Delhi: What's on agenda for Canada PM's first official visit to India
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney begins a four-day visit to India, aiming to strengthen bilateral ties with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The agenda includes discussions on trade, investment, energy, critical minerals, and people-to-people connections, seeking to inject fresh momentum after a diplomatic row.

title: Tech start-up CEO says he‚Äôs being forced to leave Sweden amid product success
content: Indian entrepreneur Abhijith Nag Balasubramanya is stepping down as CEO of Hydro Space Sweden AB and leaving the country due to the Swedish Migration Agency's denial of his residency. He cited 'xenophobia and hostile' immigration policies, alleging gross incompetence and systemic hostility from the agency, which he claims forced him to sell his successful agri-tech startup.

title: Woman, 3 kids found dead with throats slit in Delhi; missing husband is main suspect
content: In a horrifying case from Outer Delhi, a 30-year-old woman and her three young daughters were found dead in their residence, their throats brutally slit. Investigators have identified the husband, a vegetable seller who has gone missing, as the primary suspect. Authorities are probing whether sedatives were administered before the killings, with forensic experts analyzing food samples for clues.

title: BSNL director show-caused for 'absurd' trip demands: Jyotiraditya Scindia
content: Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has deemed BSNL director Vivek Banzal's lavish, now-canceled trip to Prayagraj "improper and absurd."  Appropriate action will be taken against the senior executive, with a show-cause notice already issued. The extravagant arrangements, including extensive personal kits and nearly 50 officials, sparked widespread concern over misuse of resources.

title: RTI Act not right tool to obtain spouse‚Äôs I-T returns, says Karnataka high court
content: The Karnataka High Court ruled that RTI Act is not for obtaining a spouse's income-tax returns in maintenance cases, emphasizing its purpose is public accountability, not private litigation. The court stated such returns are personal information exempt from disclosure unless larger public interest is proven. New guidelines were issued for handling such requests during maintenance proceedings.

title: ‚ÄòCalculated move to undermine institution‚Äô: SC bans NCERT book with ‚Äòoffending chapter‚Äô on judiciary
content: The Supreme Court sharply criticized the NCERT for a Class 8 textbook chapter on the judiciary, calling it a "deep-rooted, well-planned conspiracy" to defame the institution. The court issued a show-cause notice to NCERT officials. Following the strong remarks, the NCERT withdrew the revised textbook and began retrieving sold copies.

title: Bihar man who shot bride on stage during jaimala absconding
content: What began as a festive wedding in Buxar descended into chaos when gunshots rang out during the exchange-of-garlands ceremony. The bride, 18-year-old Aarti Kumari, was hit by a bullet on stage, in what authorities believe was a targeted attack by a neighbour nursing unreciprocated feelings. Quickly shifted to Varanasi for treatment, she has since been declared out of danger.

title: Were Seahawks Invited to White House? Mike Macdonald Responds
content: Rumors claimed the Seattle Seahawks declined a White House visit after their Super Bowl win, but coach Mike Macdonald confirmed no invitation has been received. He said the team will decide together if one arrives. The situation reflects how championship visits now involve timing, logistics, and personal choice. Until an official invite comes from the White House, any claims about Seattle‚Äôs decision remain premature speculation rather than fact.

title: No room for error: Team India eyes big win vs Zimbabwe at Chepauk
content: India face a crucial T20 World Cup match against Zimbabwe, with their qualification hopes hinging on other results. Batting order changes are likely, potentially seeing Sanju Samson open. Coach Kotak acknowledges batting struggles but defends recent performances. Axar Patel's return is also expected as India aims to regain momentum on a potentially high-scoring Chepauk pitch.

title: CM Rekha Gupta meets 3 northeast women, says ‚Äòno scope of hatred, racial abuse in Delhi‚Äô
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta met three young women from Arunachal Pradesh who faced alleged racial abuse. She assured them and their community of full support, emphasizing Delhi's commitment to diversity and respect. Gupta stated that strict action will be taken against the perpetrators and urged against politicizing the sensitive matter.

title: Delhi BBA student drove Thar that killed Bhopal tourist in Goa
content: A 19-year-old BBA student, Shaurya Goyal, has been arrested and released on bail in Goa following a fatal accident. Police confirm Goyal was driving the Mahindra Thar that collided with a car, killing 65-year-old tourist Bhagat Ram Sharma. Eyewitness claims of a female driver have been dismissed by authorities, citing CCTV evidence.

title: Himachal vs Delhi cops: Major showdown over arrest of Youth Congress members ‚Äî how drama unfolded
content: A pre-dawn arrest operation in Rohru by Delhi Police for a protest-related FIR escalated into an inter-state clash. Himachal Pradesh Police intervened, citing procedural irregularities and a complaint of forcible detention and CCTV DVR seizure. After a legal battle, a transit remand was granted, but further detentions occurred, highlighting a jurisdictional dispute.

title: 'Living in la-la land': India slams Pakistan's 'incessant propaganda' at UN
content: India strongly rebuked Pakistan at the UN Human Rights Council, dismissing its allegations regarding Jammu and Kashmir as "incessant propaganda." New Delhi highlighted the region's development budget exceeding Pakistan's IMF bailout and pointed to infrastructure projects like the Chenab Rail Bridge as proof of progress, asserting that Kashmir is an integral part of India.

title: ‚ÄòVery sorry‚Äô: Shanaka‚Äôs emotional apology after Sri Lanka‚Äôs T20 WC humiliation
content: Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup campaign ended in disappointment, with captain Dasun Shanaka issuing a heartfelt apology to fans. He cited failures, fitness concerns, and missed opportunities as reasons for the team's exit in the Super Eight stage. Shanaka acknowledged the team's fitness levels lag behind global standards and called for long-term planning.

title: DNPA Conclave 2026: AI, policy shifts and platform changes redrawing future of digital news
content: DNPA chairperson Mariam Mammen Mathew highlighted how AI and digital shifts are transforming news creation, distribution, and monetization. She stressed the importance of credible journalism anchoring technological advancements and DNPA's role in fostering collaboration and policy engagement to navigate these disruptions and ensure sustainable growth.

title: IND vs ZIM: India hope batters improve against off-spinners in must-win game
content: India's opening pair, Abhishek Sharma and Ishan Kishan, have struggled significantly in the T20 World Cup, averaging a dismal 6.8. Abhishek's poor form, marked by consecutive ducks, is a major concern, while the middle order also faces challenges against off-spin. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak remains confident in their ability to bounce back.

title: Trump to raise tariff to 15% or more for some; no hike for China
content: Greer said the Trump administration does not plan to raise tariffs on Chinese imports beyond their current levels, as President Donald Trump is expected to visit China in the coming weeks.

title: Chiranjeevi, Allu Arjun, Ram Charan shape Tollywood; next gen set to rise
content: The Allu-Konidela family reigns supreme in Telugu cinema, a legacy built by comedian Allu Ramalingaiah and filmmaker Allu Arvind. Megastar Chiranjeevi and his brother Pawan Kalyan, alongside their children like Ram Charan and Allu Arjun, continue this powerhouse dynasty. Their next generation is already making waves, ensuring the family's enduring influence.

title: Telangana senior sweepers earn Rs 2L a month, says chief secretary K Ramakrishna Rao
content: Telangana's monthly salary and pension bill has quadrupled to Rs 6,000 crore in a decade, with power utility chief engineers earning up to Rs 7 lakh and senior Class 4 employees around Rs 2 lakh. This surge, driven by successive pay revisions, has intensified competition for government jobs, despite the state's strong economic performance and revenue growth.

title: Jason Kelce Blasts ‚ÄòConfusing‚Äô Ref Calls at USA Gold Showdown
content: Jason Kelce voiced strong criticism of the officiating during the USA vs. Canada women's Olympic hockey final, despite Team USA's overtime victory. While celebrating the gold medal win and the men's team's subsequent triumph over Canada, Kelce expressed frustration with what he perceived as inconsistent calls throughout the intense gold medal game.

title: Bill Gates admits affairs but denies involvement in Epstein crimes
content: Bill Gates has admitted making a "huge mistake" in associating with Jeffrey Epstein, telling staff at his charity foundation that he had affairs with two Russian women but denying involvement in the disgraced financier's crimes. "It was a huge mistake to spend time with Epstein" and to also bring Gates Foundation executives into meetings with Epstein, he said.

title: Canada signals shift, says India not linked to violent crimes anymore
content: Canada now believes India is not linked to violent crimes on its soil, signaling a diplomatic thaw ahead of Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit. This shift follows months of strained ties and high-level security dialogue, with Ottawa confident alleged activities are no longer continuing. The visit aims to stabilize relations and expand cooperation in various sectors.

title: What Happened to Vince McMahon After WWE Exit? Investigations and Fallout
content: Vince McMahon, a titan of wrestling, faces legal battles including federal sex trafficking probes and SEC fines after exiting WWE.  Rumours swirl of a potential multi-billion dollar comeback bid, backed by Saudi investors, aiming to re-privatise the company.  Despite legal woes, his net worth remains substantial, and he's launched a new investment firm.

title: 'Yadav Ji ki...' doesn't defame community: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea to ban or alter the title of the film 'Yadav Ji ki Love Story'. Justices Nagarathna and Bhuyan found no negative portrayal of the Yadav community in the title, deeming the petitioner's concerns 'wholly unfounded'.

title: T20 World Cup: After the Ahmedabad blip, India have no room to slip up
content: India are up against an opposition - Zimbabwe - that already silenced a home crowd in the group stages when they beat Sri Lanka in Colombo, and Thursday presents them another opportunity to replicate that success at the noisy Chepauk. Both teams find themselves in a must-win situation and Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl didn't venture into the "dangerous" territory of silencing India in India.

title: Gangster ‚ÄòNaveen Boxer‚Äô claims responsibility for firing at Lawrence Bishnoi lawyer‚Äôs car
content: Delhi Police have registered a case after shots were fired at a car carrying a lawyer allegedly linked to gangster Lawrence Bishnoi. A social media post, purportedly from rival gangster Naveen Boxer, claimed responsibility, accusing the lawyer of acting as an informer and middleman. The attack, which saw four rounds fired, is under investigation with CCTV footage being analyzed.

title: 'Had arms, Molotov cocktails': Cuban forces engage gunmen on speedboat allegedly from US
content: Cuba reported its troops killed four individuals and wounded six others after a Florida-registered speedboat entered its waters and opened fire. The government claims the boat initiated the exchange, injuring a Cuban officer. Suspects detained stated their intent was terrorism, raising tensions between the US and Cuba.

title: Ex-YouTuber texts mother in Kuwait, hangs self at Hyderabad home
content: A 20-year-old student tragically died by suicide in Hyderabad, reportedly due to unrequited love. The undergraduate, who previously created content for a YouTube channel, was found hanging in her rented flat. Her mother revealed a prior suicide attempt and a three-year relationship with a software employee who allegedly rejected her advances.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly emotional ahead of wedding to Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have a lot of plans to make about their future together as they are all set to turn a new and the most exciting chapter of their lives. Amid this, it seems the billionaire pop star is struggling as she faces emotional turmoil over her involvement in Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's legal drama, that has lasted over a year now.

title: AI protest fallout: 20 Delhi cops detained in Himachal, freed & stopped again
content: A jurisdictional dispute erupted after Shimla Police filed an FIR against Delhi Police personnel for allegedly abducting three Youth Congress members. The Delhi team was detained, released by a court, and then detained again, escalating tensions between the two state police forces.

title: 'Hum sath aage badh rahe hain': Netanyahu shares car ride with PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shared a car ride to a technology exhibition after Modi addressed the Knesset. Modi was honored with the "Speaker of the Knesset Medal" for strengthening bilateral ties. Netanyahu praised Modi's strong moral support following the October 7th Hamas attack.

title: Pakistan semi-final scenario: What Sri Lanka exit means for their chances
content: New Zealand's decisive win over Sri Lanka has eliminated the co-hosts from the T20 World Cup. This result, however, keeps Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive. The final qualification spot from Group 2 now hinges on the England versus New Zealand match, with Pakistan needing a significant victory in their final game to potentially advance.

title: Sai Pallavi's home & project: Actor prefers simple family spaces over luxury
content: Sai Pallavi, a humble actress with an estimated net worth of Rs 45-50 crore, prefers serene, family-oriented homes over lavish properties. Her main residence in Coimbatore reflects a traditional South Indian style, emphasizing comfort and nature. She also owns a peaceful retreat in Kotagiri, showcasing her connection to the environment and simple living.

title: Karol Bagh Store To Judges' Tea Meet: BTS Of Supreme Court's NCERT Takedown
content: Behind the Supreme Court's tough words and a blanket ban on the NCERT book with a controversial chapter on judiciary were two days of frenetic activity through which a copy of the book was arranged for Chief Justice of India Surya Kant

title: BJP Alleges Trinamool Leader's Link With Suspect In Bengal Realtor's Murder
content: A day after a real estate developer was shot dead in full public view in West Bengal's Howrah district, the BJP has alleged a Trinamool Congress MLA's links with one of the suspects in the case.

title: Watch: Huge Python Swims Through Flooded Streets Of Bali
content: A massive python was spotted gliding through the flooded streets of Bali after three days of unrelenting rain transformed the island's roads into waterways.

title: PM Modi Israel visit LIVE: 'Modi' Chants In Israel Parliament As PM Gets Knesset Speaker Medal
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: They Went To Arrest 3 Men, Were Detained Themselves: The Cop vs Cop Thriller
content: It began early. Very early. At 5 am on Wednesday. And the tug-of-war between the two state police forces dragged on till 6 am the following day.

title: Would New PM Shake Nepal's Delicate India-China Balance? What Experts Said
content: Nepal votes next week for the first time since deadly anti-corruption protests toppled the government.

title: Fair Revenue Share For Content Creators A Must: Ashwini Vaishnaw At DNPA Conclave
content: Deepfakes and coordinated disinformation campaigns are putting global trust at risk, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Thursday.

title: Stephen Hawking Seen Sipping Drinks With Women In Bikinis In Epstein Files
content: Two bikini-clad women were seen on either side of late physicist Stephen Hawking in photographs from the Jeffrey Epstein files.

title: 2 Lakhs To Senior Sweepers, 7 Lakhs To Engineers: Telangana's Monthly Salary Surges
content: Officials said that the high wage is largely because of successive pay revisions often timed around election cycles, which have raised fixed expenditure.

title: Near-Blind Rohingya Refugee Dumped By US Border Patrol Found Dead
content: Nurul Amin Shah Alam, 56, had been missing since February 19, when US Border Patrol agents dropped him off at a coffee shop miles from his home following his release from a county jail.

title: Helipad, Swimming Pool, Gym: Anil Ambani's Rs 3,716 Crore 17-Floor 'Abode' In Mumbai
content: Anil Ambani's Mumbai house, 'Abode', worth Rs 3,716 crore, was attached by the Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday.

title: Inside Bill Gates' Affair With Russian Woman And Their Epstein Connection
content: Bill Gates has continued to insist that the women involved were not connected to Epstein's crimes and stated that he did not know about the financier's illegal activities at the time.

title: NEET Exam Wasn't The Reason Lucknow Man Killed, Chopped Up His Father
content: In an act of revenge, Akshat went to his father's room around 4 am, took the rifle, and shot him in his sleep.

title: Shashi Tharoor Rejects 'Pro-Modi' Tag, Says Principles Intact And No Shift In Loyalty
content: Senior Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has firmly rejected accusations that his public praise of Prime Minister Narendra Modi indicates a shift in political loyalty or has contributed to internal friction within the Indian National Congress.

title: Delhi Airport To Shut One Of 4 Runways For 3 Months For Major Repair Work
content: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport will shut one of its four runways for nearly three months starting February 26 for major rehabilitation work, according to a Notice to Air Missions (NOTAM) issued by the Airports Authority of India.

title: 'J&K Development Budget More Than Pak IMF Bailout': India's 'La La Land' Jibe
content: India has slammed Pakistan at the UN Human Rights Council for spreading misinformation about the development of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Opinion: Opinion | A BAFTA Award, Straight From The Ashes Of Manipur's Moreh
content: The shooting for 'Boong' in Moreh wrapped up barely a week before violence engulfed the township. Many who stood behind and before the camera are today internally displaced.

title: Gold, Silver Prices Drop In Domestic Markets Amid Profit Booking
content: Gold and silver prices opened lower in domestic futures trade on Thursday, tracking profit booking after recent gains.

title: 29 Aircraft, 42 Warships, Submarines: Indian Navy's Mega Exercise In Bay Of Bengal
content: Indian Navy's maritime exercise Milan concluded on Wednesday, witnessing the participation of 42 warships and submarines and 29 military aircraft.

title: "Judiciary Is Bleeding Today": Chief Justice's Top Quotes In NCERT Row Case
content: An irate Supreme Court on Thursday pulled up the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) over its Class 8 textbook chapter on "corruption" in the judiciary.

title: With new data sources and process upgrades, new GDP data set to capture the economy more accurately
content: The new series of national accounts to be released on Friday is the culmination of a wide consultative process, spanning multiple sub-committees and incorporating many changes

title: Several school students fall ill during campaign for filariasis elimination in Patna
content: The illness is said to be a side-effect of Albendazole medicine, administered to the school students under the MDA programme, an official said

title: President Murmu inaugurates National Health Fair in Shegaon, urges public movement to preserve medicinal plants
content: The National Health Fair, which will remain open for public participation, features free health check-ups and consultations by renowned expert doctors from across the country

title: Court acquits Sanjay Raut in defamation case filed by BJP leader Somaiya's wife
content: The BJP leader's wife had dragged the Rajya Sabha member to court, accusing them of being involved in a ‚Çπ100 crore scam related to the construction of public toilets in the Mira-Bhayander Municipal Corporation area

title: Claims of KSU attack on Health Minister Veena George ‚Äòdrama‚Äô, says Kerala Opposition Leader
content: V.D. Satheesan says railway police investigation found no evidence of any attack and that Speaker should not have become ‚Äòpart of such a conspiracy‚Äô

title: Diminished India's moral standing: Congress slams Modi's address to Israeli Parliament
content: Hitting out at PM Modi, the opposition party recalled India's first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru's July 1947 reply to Albert Einstein's letter to him on the subject of the creation of Israel

title: Student council opposes Azim Premji University‚Äôs FIR against Spark Reading Circle, flags ‚Äòasymmetry in outcomes‚Äô following vandalism at campus
content: Individuals accused of entering the campus without permission, assaulting members of the university community, and damaging property are facing bailable charges while students who organised a ‚Äòpeaceful gathering‚Äô are reportedly booked for a non-bailable offence

title: KSRTC bus crashes into shop after driver suffers cardiac arrest in Kerala's Alappuzha
content: Driver rushed to a private hospital where he later died. No one suffered any major injuries, says police

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs emergency care centres treat 2.29 lakh patients in 12 years
content: The State now has 12 ECCs, run by EMRI Green Health Services under the Tamil Nadu Health System Project, strategically located along key highways and high-risk stretches

title: India-U.S. deal: Rajasthan Congress MLAs protest in Assembly wearing 'PM is compromised' t-shirts
content: The legislators gathered in front of the entry of Rajasthan Assembly's main complex, holding placards and raising slogans

title: T.N. Assembly election: Income Tax Dept. sets up 24x7 control room
content: Persons with information about the storage, possession, or movement of large amounts of cash, jewellery, or other valuables and freebies were requested to pass it on to the department.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Rohit Pawar, his cousin approach Baramati police against VSR Ventures
content: The move comes a day after Rohit Pawar filed a similar complaint at the Marine Drive police station in Mumbai against VSR Ventures and its directors

title: CPI(M) rejects Congress charge that Kerala Health Minister Veena George feigned injury during KSU protest in Kannur
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan accuses Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan of ‚Äòsanctioning organised criminal attacks‚Äô against Veena George. KPCC president says police have foisted ‚Äòfalse cases‚Äô on the KSU workers, including charges of attempted murder, at the instance of CPI(M) leadership

title: Rajya Sabha elections: How are polls to the Parliament‚Äôs Upper House held?
content: Rajya Sabha is a permanent body where one-third of the members retire every two years, each serving a six-year term

title: Mallikarjun Mutya of Mahal Roja Mutt in Yadgir district of Karnataka booked under POCSO Act for allegedly misbehaving with minor girl
content: The police action came after Child Development Project Officer, Shahapur, lodged a complaint as per instructions issued by the District Child Welfare Committee, which conducted an enquiry with the girl and her parents as well

title: Tamil Nadu: a trendsetter for all-round development
content: Unlike in other States such as Maharashtra and Karnataka, where economic activity is concentrated in a couple of cities, Tamil Nadu has been witnessing dispersed development.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Rohit Pawar accuses Mumbai police of not registering FIR, his complaint sent to State CID
content: Marine Drive Police station issued a statement saying that as per an already existent FIR, the case was being probed by the Maharashtra Crime Investigation Department

title: SC hearing on NCERT Class 8 textbook LIVE: Supreme Court orders blanket ban on NCERT textbook with chapter on 'corruption' in judiciary
content: Current apology not enough; an unqualified and unconditional apology will be published, the Solicitor General said

title: Book on life, journey of journalist late N. R. Swami released in Odisha
content: The book titled ‚ÄòThe Doyen of Odisha Journalism‚Äô highlights Swami‚Äôs protracted court battle against Odisha government accused him of being on the payroll of a foreign agency

title: YSRCP chief Jagan visits temple in Pulivendula constituency
content: He also conducted a ‚ÄòPraja Darbar‚Äô at his camp office and received grievances from people from his constituency

title: Kerala veers from impressive social gains to mounting fiscal strain
content: The biggest challenge faced by successive State governments in Kerala has been keeping expenditure down without undermining its pro-social sector fiscal policies.

title: Dream of Karnataka govt. jobs brings youth in droves to Dharwad‚Äôs coaching centres and study halls
content: For long Dharwad has been the education hub of north Karnataka. Cashing on the brand name of Dharwad, over 30 coaching centres have come up here over the last few years

title: Govt. mandates sale of 20% ethanol-blended petrol with minimum RON 95 nationwide from April 1
content: The central government can allow exceptions in special situations, for specific regions and for a limited time

title: AI Summit protest: Dramatic standoff between Delhi and Shimla police ends after 24 hours
content: The Himachal Pradesh Police registered a kidnapping case against the Delhi Police personnel and "detained" their vehicles at the Shogi border near Shimla on February 25, 2026

title: CM Adityanath invited Japanese entrepreneurs to invest in Uttar Pradesh
content: Mr. Adityanath also informed the Japanese that a State (U.P.) once referred to as BIMARU has today become the growth engine of India‚Äôs economy

title: Income Tax department conducts searches at lone BSP MLA house, U.P. Minister questions move
content: Dinesh Pratap Singh, a U.P. Government Minister who is related to the BSP MLA, objected to the action through posts on social media.

title: Motorists complain of bumpy ride on newly built flyover
content: They say Madhya Kailash flyover does not offer a smooth ride; highway officialsÓ†ï point out that the surface was kept rough to prevent speeding

title: Two-child norm for panchayat, local body elections scrapped in Rajasthan after three decades
content: Congress strongly criticises the State Cabinet‚Äôs decision; the BJP on the one hand advises a particular community to control population growth, and was repealing the two-child norm on the other, Govind Singh Dotasra says

title: NCERT apologises, says distribution of book with section on ‚Äòcorruption‚Äô in judiciary stopped
content: After the Supreme court registers suo motu case over the matter, the NCERT apologises for the ‚Äòinappropriate textual material‚Äô and ‚Äòerror in judgement‚Äô that had ‚Äòinadvertently crept‚Äô into the chapter.

title: Political criticism that ruling party may even ‚Äògive a wife to everyone‚Äô is not misogynistic: Madras High Court
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira quashes proceedings initiated by Tamil Nadu Commission for Women against AIADMK MP C.Ve. Shanmugam for making such a statement

title: CBI arrests three in ‚Äòdigital arrest‚Äô fraud case after searches in six States
content: ‚ÄòThrough meticulous digital forensics and financial trail analysis, investigators uncovered a complex network spanning multiple States, with indications of international linkages,‚Äô the CBI says

title: Cash row: Lok Sabha Speaker reconstitutes panel probing charges against Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The Speaker had constituted the committee on August 12 last year after admitting a multi-party notice for the removal of the Allahabad High Court judge, setting in motion the process of his impeachment.

title: Karnataka High Court lays down procedure to access spouse‚Äôs income-tax returns in matrimonial disputes
content: The Karnataka High Court has issued comprehensive guidelines for spouses to obtain income tax returns and financial records of their partners in maintenance proceedings, as the law does not permit couples in matrimonial disputes to access each other‚Äôs financial data under the Right to Information Act

title: Govt. IVF services changing fertility landscape in Telangana; State-run hospitals log 190 infertility cases
content: This case comes amid a steady expansion of infertility services at government healthcare institutions in Telangana over the past year.

title: Rahul targets Modi over trip to Israel and trade deal with U.S., brings up ‚ÄòEpstein Files‚Äô
content: Mr. Gandhi questions PM‚Äôs trip amid Indo-U.S. trade deal row while¬†Congress leader Pawan Khera cites ‚ÄòEpstein Files‚Äô emails, alleging foundation of India-Israel ties was laid by late¬†American financier and child sex offender¬†Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Food Safety officers launch State-wide milk safety inspections after deaths
content: Samples of milk and other dairy products are being collected from vendors to check if there is any urea or starch adulteration, says State IPM Director

title: Real-estate promoter shot dead in Howrah, journalist assaulted after questioning Trinamool MLA over links to the crime
content: Videos of the accused in the murder riding pillion on local Trinamool Congress¬†MLA Gautam Chowdhury‚Äôs motorbike surfaced on social media

title: Officials to keep track of census data collection real time
content: Around 32 lakh field functionaries will be deployed for census operations; satellite imagery will be used for clear identification of habitations and settlements

title: NIA arrests two more accused in Delhi car bomb blast case
content: The federal agency says the two are over ground workers of the Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGH) terror outfit and allegedly supplied weapons to the prime accused in the case, Umar Un Nabi, who was also killed in the explosion

title: Amit Shah on three-day visit to Bihar‚Äôs Seemanchal
content: In three-day visit, the Home Minister will participate in various initiatives, including the inauguration of border outposts, and the e-inauguration and foundation laying of several works of the Sashastra Seema Bal

title: SRMIST, The Hindu to organise panel discussion series on future careers
content: The series is aimed at benefiting undergraduate aspirants, postgraduate candidates, and working professionals in various fields such as humanities and sciences, entrepreneurship, law, public health, pharmacology, allied health sciences and nursing, medical and dental sciences, occupational therapy and physiotherapy, engineering, and agriculture.

title: 629 cow smuggling cases registered in Gujarat in two years
content: Minister of State for Law and Justice Kaushik Vekariya said 50 people were externed and 39 properties linked to the accused, collectively valued at around ‚Çπ6 crore, were demolished

title: Cases stall as judicial officers busy with SIR in West Bengal
content: Former Rajya Sabha MP Jawhar Sircar, who had served as Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal, said that involving judicial officers in SIR appeared to be a ‚Äòknee-jerk reaction‚Äô

title: SIM-binding directions for platforms to stay: Minister
content: The November 2025 order, due for compliance this month, will not be extended, says Communications Minister. He says ‚Äònational security‚Äô and ‚Äòfraud‚Äô were considered in issuing this order, which WhatsApp parent Meta has pushed back on through industry associations.

title: ‚ÄòShirtless‚Äô protest: Three more Congress workers held in Shimla
content: Saurabh, Siddharth and Arbaz apprehended by Special Cell of Delhi Police from a hotel in Shimla district; arrests led to a dramatic turn of events after Himachal Police intercepted the Delhi Police team while they were transporting the accused to Delhi

title: Bill meant to replace UGC, AICTE circulated among 39 Ministries, departments for discussions, says government
content: 31-member JPC, which was set up to examine Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, will hold its first meeting today Bill

title: Centre rejects RTI seeking details of pre-legislative consultations on VB-G RAM G Act
content: In its response, the Rural Development Ministry said the information could not be shared because the scheme ‚Äòhas not yet been formally notified by the States/UTs and has not become operational in any State/U.T.‚Äô

title: ‚ÄòLoose connection‚Äô prevented NVS-02 satellite from landing in intended orbit, says panel
content: The committee, which probed the failure, says the signal meant to activate a key valve in the engine‚Äôs oxidiser line never reached it; this valve is crucial for firing the engine to raise the spacecraft‚Äôs orbit

title: PM Modi conferred with Israel‚Äôs ‚ÄòSpeaker of the Knesset Medal‚Äô
content: The medal was conferred in recognition of the Prime Minister‚Äôs exceptional contribution ‚Äî through his personal leadership ‚Äî to strengthen strategic relations between India and Israel

title: Palaniswami hits back at Stalin, calls the DMK a ‚Äòslave‚Äô of the Congress
content: ‚ÄòWe have never been slaves of anyone. We believe in our constructive work. By implementing [welfare] projects, we had secured the support [of the Centre]. But your party is not like us. The Congress had secured seats by intimidating the¬†DMK,‚Äô the AIADMK leader says at a meeting at Vanagaram near Chennai

title: Ahead of Assembly election, DMK women‚Äôs  grassroots push blends politics with AR outreach
content: ‚ÄòVellum Tamil Pengal‚Äô campaign deploys booth-level women cadres armed with booklets, QR codes and augmented reality to deepen voter connect ‚Äî while opening new space for women in party politics.

title: ECI proposes synergy with SECs to align electoral processes nationwide
content: Commission moots sharing of Electronic Voting Machines (EVM), electoral rolls and the ECINET digital platform.

title: Kochi City police screen footage of accidents to sensitise bus drivers
content: Videos of around 25 recent accidents, captured by CCTVs on the accident spots and those installed inside buses, from different parts of the State were screened

title: India ‚Äòstands firmly‚Äô with Israel, Modi tells Knesset
content: Prime Minister addresses the Israeli parliament as he begins visit to the West Asian country; India has an uncompromising policy of zero tolerance for terrorism with no double standard, he adds

title: 1.2 crore names may be deleted after SIR in Bengal, says Mamata
content: Will pray for the people who will find their names deleted from the final electoral rolls on February 28, says Trinamool Congress chairperson ¬†

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Ranya, others in gold smuggling and money laundering case
content: According to the ED, its investigation revealed that a total of 127.287 kg of gold valued at approximately ‚Çπ102.55 crore was smuggled into India between March 2024 and March 2025

title: Government to procure business jets for defence dignitaries and chiefs of armed forces
content: The decision to get a new fleet comes in the backdrop of the crash of a VSR Ventures-owned aircraft on January 28 that claimed the lives of Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra‚Äôs Deputy Chief Minister, and four others

title: PM Modi, Netanyahu discuss wide range of issues aimed at boosting bilateral ties
content: Narendra Modi, who is visiting Israel for the second time in nine years, was received by Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife, Sara, at the airport.

title: Police intensify probe into IIT Palakkad attack
content: Police suspect the assault was premeditated, noting that it took place in a poorly lit area of the campus that lacked surveillance camera coverage

title: ‚ÄòKaraparamba fish market, Puthiyangadi market buildings in need of urgent action‚Äô
content: An inspection by a team of engineers under the Kozhikode Corporation have so far completed the inspection of 12 age-old buildings within the city to check their fitness

title: MMA divisional rankings: Heavyweight top 10 is light on changes or impact
content: the heavyweight division is seriously lacking in depth and activity at the top . the fight ended prematurely as a no-contest after he suffered eye pokes that required surgery and threaten to end his career . it's not going to stay in a valley forever, but MMA fans will await that day eagerly .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Ranking all 30 MLB lineups for 2026
content: Hall of Famer Rogers Hornsby uttered a romantic quote . "people ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball," he said . he swaps cards from team to team, envisioning what the next summer would look like .

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .
